title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 86.1 - Definition
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 86.1 - Definition

State Regulations

The Mount Sinai Harbor Wetlands Cooperator Area refers to
the area of salt marsh and tidal flats south of the dredged zone and below the
mean high tide line in Mount Sinai Harbor, Long Island, NY. The exact
boundaries of the area are on file in the Department of Environmental

Conservation office at Stony Brook. The area is also posted with signs erected
by the Department of Environmental Conservation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
86.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
